Miller: Bitcoin อาจจะมีราคาต่ำสุดที่ระดับ 60,000 ดอลลาร์

Miller: Bitcoin Might Bottom Out at $60K

1d ago//Alex Dovbnya
bitcoin
AI

Summary

TH

นักลงทุน Bill Miller IV คาดการณ์ว่า Bitcoin อาจเข้าสู่ภาวะคงตัวและพบกับจุดพักตัวของตลาดที่ระดับ $60,000 เมื่อนักลงทุนที่มีแนวโน้มขายทันที (weak hands) ถูกกัดกร่อนออกไปจากตลาด เขาอ้างอิงการคาดการณ์นี้จากต้นทุนการผลิตเชิงเงินสดโดยประมาณในการขุดเหรียญใหม่ และข้อมูลในอดีตที่บ่งชี้ว่าจุดต่ำสุดของตลาดมักเกิดขึ้นเมื่อสัดส่วนอุปทานที่ขาดทุนมากกว่ากำไร นอกจากนี้ ดัชนี 3-day Relative Strength Index (RSI) ยังแสดงให้เห็นว่า Bitcoin อยู่ในภาวะขายล้นตัวอย่างรุนแรง ซึ่งเป็นสัญญาณทางเทคนิคที่ในอดีตเคยบ่งบอกจุดสิ้นสุดของตลาดขาลง

EN

Investor Bill Miller IV predicts that Bitcoin could stabilize and find its market bottom at $60,000 as weak-handed investors are shaken out during the ongoing collapse. He bases this projection on the estimated cash production cost to mine new coins and historical data indicating that market bottoms occur when the percentage of supply in loss exceeds supply in profit. Additionally, the 3-day Relative Strength Index (RSI) shows Bitcoin is in extremely oversold territory, a technical signal that has historically marked the end of bear markets.

Key Points

  • Bill Miller IV forecasts a Bitcoin market bottom at $60,000.
  • The price level aligns with the cash production cost of mining and historical supply loss metrics.
  • Miners may shut down or hoard coins if prices drop below production costs.
  • The 3D RSI indicates extremely oversold conditions, suggesting a bear market end may be near.

Article

Cover image via www.youtube.com Disclaimer: The opinions expressed by our writers are their own and do not represent the views of U.Today. The financial and market information provided on U.Today is intended for informational purposes only. U.Today is not liable for any financial losses incurred while trading cryptocurrencies. Conduct your own research by contacting financial experts before making any investment decisions. We believe that all content is accurate as of the date of publication, but certain offers mentioned may no longer be available. During the ongoing cryptocurrency market collapse, one question dominates: Where is the bottom? According to investor Bill Miller IV, $60,000 is the critical level where the market likely stabilizes, with "weak hands" being finally shaken out. The two key reasons Miller has pointed to the cash production cost of creating every new coin. HOT Stories If the market price drops below the cost to produce the asset, miners might be forced to either shut down their rigs to stop losing money or hoard their coins. Notably, as reported by U.Today , JPMorgan recently estimated that Bitcoin's price is currently trading well below its production cost ($87,000). This is well above Miller's estimate. In a separate post, he has clarified that it excludes depreciation, meaning that it does not include the millions of dollars the miners already spent to buy the ASICs. You Might Also Like Miller has also noted that $60,000 is precisely where the percentage of supply in loss exceeds the percentage of supply in profit. This has had prior market bottoms. Is the bottom actually near? If history is any guide, Bitcoin might actually be approaching a major bottom. The 3D RSI (3-day relative strength index), a momentum indicator used to measure whether an asset is "overbought," is currently in extremely oversold territory. Every time this happened, it marked the end of a bear market. There have been only four such occasions so far. For instance, the RSI hitting the aforementioned zone marked the exact bottom of the 2018 crash (near $3,200). Hence, if this time is not different, either the bottom is already in, or it will happen within roughly 100 days.
